remarks: Condition that determines a hyperplane.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lshpnel2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lshpnel2.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lshpnel2.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lshpnel2.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` W ) $.
lshpnel2.h $e |- H = ( LSHyp ` W ) $.
lshpnel2.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lshpnel2.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lshpnel2.t $e |- ( ph -> U =/= V ) $.
lshpnel2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lshpnel2.e $e |- ( ph -> -. X e. U ) $.
lshpnel2N $p |- ( ph -> ( U e. H <-> ( U .(+) ( N ` { X } ) ) = V ) ) $.
